New Records: Shubman Gill scored the fastest century (92 runs in 92 balls) in his ODI debut.
India achieved the highest score of 357/8 in a World Cup match.
Ravindra Jadeja became the first player to be run out in a World Cup match after 49 overs.
Mohammed Shami took 5/18, the best bowling figures in a World Cup match for India.
Rohit Sharma became the first player to score 10,000 ODI runs.
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka elected to field first but the match was reduced to 19.4 overs due to rain.
India scored 357/8, the highest score in a World Cup match at Wankhede Stadium.
Shubman Gill and Virat Kohli formed a 192-run partnership, the highest for India in ODIs.
Mohammed Shami took 5 wickets for 18 runs, the best bowling performance in a World Cup match.
Ravindra Jadeja was run out after 49 overs, the first such instance in a World Cup match.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka won the toss and elected to field first.
The match was affected by rain, reducing it to 19.4 overs.
India's batting lineup was focused on aggressive scoring from the start.
Sri Lanka's spinners were expected to play a key role in containing India's batting.
Post-Match Reflections: Mohammed Shami was named Player of the Match for his exceptional bowling performance.
Rohit Sharma praised the team's resilience after the match.
The win gave India a boost in their World Cup campaign.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka's total of 55 runs was their lowest in a World Cup match.
The match was played on a spin-friendly pitch, which favored India's spinners.
The rain interruption and early finish added to the challenge for Sri Lanka.
Others: The match was the 33rd of the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023-24 season.
It was the second match of the series between India and Sri Lanka.
